name: HTML/CSS Portfolio
description: A portfolio utilising HTML and CSS, incorporating skills learned during the previous week, including Flexbox, CSS variables, media queries and deployment to GitHub Pages.

name: Bootstrap Portfolio
description: Another portfolio version, this time incorporating Bootstrap. The task was to remake the previous iteration utilising Bootstrap, which gave me an opportunity to improve upon the first version with new skills acquired, and deeper understanding of the core skills.

name: Console Finances
description: Using JavaScript, and given a dataset composed of arrays containing two fields, `Date` and `Profit/Losses`, the code analyses the dataset, calculates the required tasks, and prints the results to the browser console. This tasks was to demonstrate ability with JavaScript fundamentals.

name: Password Generator
description: A browser-based password generator, that prompts the user for choices, and outputs a randomized password based on those choices. This was to demonstrate intermediate Javascript skills.

name: Code Quiz
description: A timed coding quiz, using multiple-choice questions that dynamically updates the HTML and CSS using JavaScript, allowing the app to keep time and score, and adapt both based on user input. It also allows the user to save their score, and initials, at the conclusion of the quiz. This challenge had a focus on demonstrating ability with more advanced JavaScript and Web APIs, such as localStorage and setInterval.

name: Day Planner
description: A browser app to schedule your day. Dynamically updating HTML and CSS using JQuery, the user can input events by the hour, and save those inputs across sessions. The app also provides basic color-coding to indicate if an event is past, present or future, of the current time. This challenge focused on demonstrating skills in DOM manipulation, advanced JavaScript and integration of third-party APIs.

name: Weather Dashboard
description: A weather dashboard providing a five-day forecast for a location input by the user. It also locally saves previously entered locations which can be used to conveniently recall data for that location. This challenge had a particular focus on demonstrating ability with Server APIs.

name: Country Info
description: A web app to find interesting, useful and concise info about a provided country, which is dynamically generated, and positioned, depending on state. The app uses 2 different server APIs (for information, and translation), as well as localStorage for saving the Wish List and Visited List.

name: Professional README Generator
description: A command-line application that dynamically generates a professional README.md file, from a user's input, using Node.js and Inquirer.

name: Team Profile Generator
description: A Node.js command-line application, that takes in information, from the user, about employees on a software engineering team, and then generates an HTML webpage that displays summaries for each person, based on that input. This challenge introduced a focus on TTD and Jest.
